lpa_pipeline.metal_toolkit

The toolkit running METAL-related pipeline internally

Example

The class should be initiated as follows:

mtk = metal_toolkit.METALToolkit(
    ethnicity = ["EU", "AF", "HISP"],
    engine_list = ["Logit", "OLS"],
    verbose = 1,
    metal_path = "/mnt/mfs/cluster/bin/METAL/metal",
    snp_alias = "variant"
    )

One-line Pipeline:

mtk.run_metal(
    path_association = "/path/of/association/module/output",
    path_meta = "/path/of/meta_analysis/output")

It internally does everything below:

mtk.copy_tree(path_association = path_association, path_meta = path_meta)

move all the file in path_association to path_meta, and properly arrange them by traits

mtk.csv_to_metal(path)

Prepare a METAL format CSV file from existing CSV file at <path>

mtk.generate_metal_script(path)

Prepare metal.sh and metal_script.txt with specified ethnicity.

subprocess(“chmod +x metal.sh” & “metal source metal_script.txt”)

run METAL from the script generated

mtk.aggregate_result(path):

After running the METAL analysis, this API will generate an aggregate table for this folder for next step analysis

pd.concat([path/aggregate.csv for path in sub_folders], axis = 0)

concatenate all the aggregate.csv

mtk.formatting_final_result(df, multi_line_header = False)

format the aggregate.csv multi_line_header is a historical problem, use False is fine. Set to True will generate another header row.

mtk.save_final_output(df,path = “path”, multi_line_header = False)

deals with a bug in pandas when using multi-line headers

The multi_line_header only makes difference at the output header, it will create another header row, just for the visualization pipeline

Module Contents

Classes

METALToolkit

Pipeline for python preparing/processing METAL's meta analysis

Attributes

parser

class lpa_pipeline.metal_toolkit.METALToolkit(ethnicity: List[str] = ['EU', 'AF', 'HISP'], engine_list: List[str] = ['OLS', 'Logit'], verbose: int = 1, metal_path: str = '/mnt/mfs/cluster/bin/METAL/metal', snp_alias: str = 'variant')

Pipeline for python preparing/processing METAL’s meta analysis

run_metal(path_association: str, path_meta: str, rename: bool = False, multi_line_header: bool = False) → pandas.DataFrame

API processing all the tables at once in a folder

It will copy the path from <path_association> (keep an unaffected version) to <path_meta> (must not already exist!) and process everything in new path to

Parameters:

  • path_association – str, the path of association outputs

  • path_meta – str, the path to meta-analysis, it must not already exist.

  • rename – boolean, using False is fine, just for formatting

  • multi_line_header – boolean, using False is fine.

Returns:

an aggregate result for meta-analysis

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

Saves:

in path_meta: - csv files with an additional “_for_metal” at the end of file name - metal.sh and metal_script.txt for metal running - aggregate.csv in each trait folder - aggregate_all_traits.xlsx in path_meta for better exploration.

dataframe_to_metal(df: pandas.DataFrame) → pandas.DataFrame

for a given association DataFrame, prepare a METAL accepted version

Parameters:

  • df – pd.DataFrame, an association table generated by

  • instance (association.SNPAssociation) –

Returns:

a tidied version of association table ready for METAL’s meta analysis

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

csv_to_metal(path: str)

API including the csv file reading and writing

Parameters:

  • path – string, the path of an association table generated by

  • instance (...pipeline.association.SNPAssociation) –

Saves:

csv file with an additional “_for_metal” at the end of the file name

generate_metal_script(path=None) → None

API generate the metal script for the meta analysis,

Parameters:

  • path – Optional[string], if given, it will save the script generated

  • well (to the path given as) –

Returns:

the script for running the meta analysis

Return type:

str

_metal_script_header() → str

prepare a header for the metal script

_metal_script_description() → str

prepare the description part of METAL script

_metal_script_analyze()

prepare the analysis part of METAL script

generate_metal_running_script(metal_path) → str

prepare the running script of METAL

_get_snp_data(path: str, key: str) → pandas.DataFrame

for a folder, and a specific key, get the requested info, add suffix

_get_pos(variant: str) → int

extract pos in integer from a string format pos-ref/alt

aggregate_result(path: str) → pandas.DataFrame

give a folder with METAL result, combine all the results

formatting_final_result(df: pandas.DataFrame, multi_line_header: bool = False, rename: bool = False) → pandas.DataFrame
copy_tree(path_association: str, path_meta: str) → None

move file from path_association to path_meta, arrange by traits

save_final_output(df: pandas.DataFrame, path: str, multi_line_header: bool) → None

wrapper saving the output file, which is for solving a bug saving pd.DataFrame with multiIndex to excel, see https://stackoverflow.com/a/71305025.

_logging(log: str) → None

just for code cleaning…

_save_double_column_df(df: pandas.DataFrame, xl_writer: pandas.ExcelWriter, start_row: int = 0, **kwargs) → None
Function saving two-level column DataFrame to xlwriter

credit to https://stackoverflow.com/a/71305025

Parameters:

  • df – pd.DataFrame, the table to save

  • xl_writer – pd.ExcelWriter, book for saving

  • start_row – int, row from which dataframe will begin

  • **kwargs – Any, arguments of to_excel function of DataFrame`
